019package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc;
020
021import static java.lang.String.format;
022import static java.lang.System.err;
023import static java.lang.System.out;
024import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.createLineNumberFormatString;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.requireNonNullArgument;
027
028import java.io.BufferedReader;
029import java.io.File;
030import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
031import java.io.FileReader;
032import java.io.FileWriter;
033import java.io.IOException;
034import java.util.ArrayList;
035import java.util.List;
036
037import org.apiguardian.api.API;
038import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit;
039import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
040import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.annotation.ProgramClass;
041import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.exception.PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError;
042
043/**
044 *  <p>{@summary A tool that can be used to create an HTML file suitable as a
045 *  documentation extension for a JavaDoc from an arbitrary text file.} The
046 *  processing of the input is as for
047 *  {@link IncludeTaglet.ProcessMode#SOURCE}.</p>
048 *  <p>The program takes two command line arguments:</p>
049 *  <ol>
050 *  <li>The file name for the input file.</li>
051 *  <li>The destination path for the output file.</li>
052 *  </ol>
053 *  <p>The name of the output file will be determined by the name of the input
054 *  file, suffixed with &quot;{@code .html}&quot;. This means, the input file
055 *  &quot;{@code MyClass.java}&quot; is written to
056 *  &quot;{@code MyClass.java.html}&quot;.</p>
057 *  <p>An already existing file will be overwritten without warning.</p>
058 *  <p><b>Note:</b> The output file should be stored into a {@code doc-files}
059 *  folder in the source tree of the project from where JavaDoc will pick it up
060 *  and amends it appropriately. This is similar to the handling of the HTML
061 *  file containing the project overview that is addressed with the
062 *  {@code -overview} option on the JavaDoc command line.</p>
063 *
064 *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
065 *  @version $Id: CreateSourceHTML.java 977 2022-01-06 11:41:03Z tquadrat $
066 *  @since 0.0.5
067 */
068@ProgramClass
069@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CreateSourceHTML.java 977 2022-01-06 11:41:03Z tquadrat $" )
070@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5")
071public final class CreateSourceHTML
072{
073        /*--------------*\
074    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
075        \*--------------*/
076    /**
077     *  No instance allowed for this class.
078     */
079    private CreateSourceHTML() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( CreateSourceHTML.class ); }
080
081        /*---------*\
082    ====** Methods **==========================================================
083        \*---------*/
084    /**
085     *  This method generates a documentation extension file in HTML format
086     *  from the given source file.
087     *
088     *  @param  inputFile   The input file.
089     *  @param  outputPath  The output path.
090     *  @throws IOException Reading or writing failed.
091     */
092    @SuppressWarnings( "resource" )
093    public static final void execute( final File inputFile, final File outputPath ) throws IOException
094    {
095        if ( !requireNonNullArgument( inputFile, "inputFile" ).exists() )
096        {
097            throw new FileNotFoundException( inputFile.getAbsolutePath() );
098        }
099        out.printf( "Input File : %s\n", inputFile.getAbsolutePath() );
100
101        if( requireNonNullArgument( outputPath, "outputPath" ).exists() && !outputPath.isDirectory() )
102        {
103            throw new IOException( format( "%s is not a directory", outputPath.getAbsolutePath() ) );
104        }
105        if( !outputPath.exists() )
106        {
107            if( !outputPath.mkdirs() )
108            {
109                throw new IOException( format( "Cannot create output directory: %s", outputPath.getAbsolutePath() ) );
110            }
111        }
112
113        final var fileName = inputFile.getName() + ".html";
114        final var outputFile = new File( outputPath, fileName );
115        out.printf( "Output File: %s\n", outputFile.getAbsolutePath() );
116
117        final List<String> lines = new ArrayList<>();
118        try( final var reader = new BufferedReader( new FileReader( inputFile ) ) )
119        {
120            reader.lines()
121                .map( ToolKit::escapeHTML )
122                .forEach( lines::add );
123        }
124
125        final var lineNumberFormat = createLineNumberFormatString( lines.size() );
126        var lineNumber = 1;
127
128        final var buffer = new StringBuilder(
129            """
130            <!DOCTYPE html>
131            <html>
132            <head>
133            <meta charset="UTF-8">
134            <title>Source Code</title>
135            </head>
136            <body>
137            <h1>Source Code</h1>
138            <p><div class="source-container"><pre>""" );
139        for( final var line : lines )
140        {
141            buffer.append( format( lineNumberFormat, lineNumber++ ) )
142                .append( line )
143                .append( '\n' );
144        }
145        buffer.append(
146            """
147            </pre></div></p>
148            </body>
149            </html>""" );
150
151        try( final var writer = new FileWriter( outputFile ) )
152        {
153            writer.append( buffer ).flush();
154        }
155
156        out.println( "Done!" );
157    }   //  execute()
158
159    /**
160     *  The program entry point.
161     *
162     *  @param  args    The command line arguments.
163     */
164    @SuppressWarnings( {"ThrowCaughtLocally", "OverlyBroadCatchBlock"} )
165    public static void main( final String... args )
166    {
167        try
168        {
169            if( args.length != 2 )
170            {
171                throw new IllegalArgumentException( format( "Usage: %s <InputFile> <OutputPath>", CreateSourceHTML.class.getSimpleName() ) );
172            }
173            final var inputFile = new File( args [0] ).getCanonicalFile().getAbsoluteFile();
174            final var outputPath = new File( args [1] ).getCanonicalFile().getAbsoluteFile();
175
176            execute( inputFile, outputPath );
177        }
178        catch( final Throwable t )
179        {
180            //---* Handle any previously unhandled exceptions *----------------
181            t.printStackTrace( err );
182        }
183    }   //  main()
184}
185//  class CreateSourceHTML
186
187/*
188 *  End of File
